activities: We provide guidance on clinical trials,including orphan drug trials, in the EU. Because of the rarity of these diseases, in some cases it may be possible to infer the identify of a study subject even though the data is effectively anonymized. In some cases, copies of source documents may not be properly anonymized when we get them. However, in no case do we attempt to match names with data, nor do we make use of any personally identifiable information with which we may accidentally become aware.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, United Kingdom
personaldata: clinical trials data, both machine-readable and manually processed; limited client data (email addresses, telephone numbers).
recoursemech: We utilize the EU data protection authorities (DPAs) for dispute resolution.
